alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 2:03PM CST until January 28 at 3:40AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River at Wharton affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Wharton. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with the JDIN Recreational Center in southwest Wharton threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Friday the stage was 38.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 41.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.1 feet on 06/26/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Colorado River Wharton 39.0 38.0 Fri 1 pm CST 39.7 21.8 16.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Saturday morning at 815 AM CST.
